metadata.title: CVE-2017-9022 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The gmp plugin in strongSwan before 5.5.3 does not properly validate RSApublic keys before calling mpz_powm_sec, which allows remote peers to causea denial of service (floating point exception and process crash) via acrafted certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.3.5-1ubuntu3.3
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.3.5-1ubuntu3.3
libstrongswan - 5.3.5-1ubuntu3.3
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.3.5-1ubuntu3.3
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.3.5-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan - 5.3.5-1ubuntu3.3

criterions.comment: strongswan package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.5-1ubuntu3.3').
